page.title: 17DONYATT POTTERY
page.content: Records show that there has been a pottery industry in the Horton and Donyatt area since the thirteenth century.Since the Second World War, the amount of pottery made has declined, but in previous centuries the potteries in this area provided most of the pottery used in this part of the west country. There is a collection of typical pieces in the Castle Museum in Taunton, and there is even some in the Smithsonian Institute in Washington, U.S.A. The clay for the pots was all dug locally and there were many sites which had kilns. Archaeologists from Taunton excavated some of the sites a few years ago, and are about to publish a report on the dig. Pieces of pottery can be easily found in the fields of Horton and Donyatt.
